Gesekan Dini Kabinet Jokowi
06 Nov 2019, 05:45 by Ali Umar
SEPERTI sudah diprediksi, Presiden Joko Widodo akhirnya melibatkan banyak partai politik dalam kabinetnya. Langkah yang bertujuan membentuk pemerintah yang kuat sekaligus efektif ini justru menimbulkan banyak mudarat. Koalisi yang terlalu besar cenderung tidak solid dan rawan gesekan politik, yang akan mengganggu kinerja kabinet.
Gejala itu langsung mencuat begitu Jokowi mengumumkan susunan Kabinet Indonesia Maju. Sejumlah partai politik kecewa lantaran tidak mendapat kursi menteri sesuai dengan harapan mereka. Ada juga partai pendukung Jokowi yang tidak memperoleh jatah sama sekali, baik kursi menteri maupun wakil menteri. Riak-riak kekecewaan itu bisa memicu langkah politik yang mengusik soliditas koalisi pendukung pemerintah.
Manuver Ketua Umum Partai Nasional Demokrat Surya Paloh cuma salah satu contoh. Ia tiba-tiba menemui Presiden Partai Keadilan Sejahtera Sohibul Iman di kantornya, akhir Oktober lalu. Sehabis pertemuan itu, Paloh menyatakan membuka opsi menjadi "penyeimbang" pemerintah seperti PKS. Ia juga berencana berkomunikasi dengan partai lain di luar kabinet, yakni Partai Amanat Nasional dan Partai Demokrat.
Langkah Paloh berpotensi merepotkan Jokowi karena NasDem berada di dalam pemerintah. NasDem mendapat tiga kursi menteri, seperti pada kabinet periode lalu. Hanya, partai ini sekarang kehilangan posisi yang penting, yakni Jaksa Agung. Pos yang semula dipegang kader NasDem, M. Prasetyo, tersebut kini ditempati St. Burhanuddin, jaksa senior yang dikenal dekat dengan kalangan Partai Demokrasi Indonesia Perjuangan.
Masuknya Ketua Umum Partai Gerindra Prabowo Subianto ke kabinet dikabarkan pula membikin Partai NasDem gerah. Prabowo, yang dikenal cukup akrab dengan Ketua Umum PDIP Megawati Soekarnoputri, diangkat menjadi Menteri Pertahanan. Situasi ini membuat posisi NasDem jadi kurang dominan di koalisi. Partai ini makin tidak nyaman lantaran hubungan Paloh dan Megawati telah renggang karena sejumlah kepala daerah yang diusung PDIP pindah ke NasDem.
Keputusan Jokowi membuat kabinet gemuk sesungguhnya didasari dua asumsi yang salah. Pertama, Jokowi menganggap pemerintahnya akan kuat jika disokong banyak partai. Ia lupa bahwa di Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat peta dukungan sangat dipengaruhi isu yang dibahas. Jika isu itu dianggap tak menguntungkan, bahkan partai koalisi pun bisa membelot. Pada periode pertama pemerintahan Jokowi, PDIP pernah tidak menyokong kebijakan pemerintah.
Asumsi keliru kedua adalah Jokowi menganggap koalisi gemuk akan memudahkannya mengambil pelbagai kebijakanumumnya yang berorientasi pembangunan. Ia menganggap selama ini banyak "rencana baik" pemerintah terhambat oleh proses politik di parlemen. Ia lupa bahwa tidak pernah ada rencana baik jika tidak diuji lewat proses checks and balances. Setiap rencana pasti mengandung daifnya.
Kini Jokowi juga mengakomodasi delapan partai politik, termasuk Partai Solidaritas Indonesia dan Partai Persatuan Indonesia. Sikap akomodatif ini telah mengundang kecemburuan Partai Hati Nurani Rakyat serta Partai Keadilan dan Persatuan Indonesia. Dua partai yang sejak periode lalu menyokong Jokowi ini tidak kebagian kursi menteri atau wakil menteri.
Rasa kecewa juga diungkapkan tokoh-tokoh Nahdlatul Ulama, organisasi keagamaan yang biasanya mendapat jatah kursi Menteri Agama. Sejak era Presiden Abdurrahman Wahid, orang NU selalu menempati pos itu. Pada kabinet periode pertama, Jokowi pun masih mengangkat tokoh NU, Lukman Hakim Saifuddin. Tapi kali ini ia mengabaikan tradisi itu dengan menempatkan Jenderal Purnawirawan Fachrul Razi sebagai Menteri Agama.
Jokowi mengangkat Fachrul dengan penugasan khusus, yakni menghadang radikalisme. Strategi mirip gaya Orde Baru ini sebetulnya berlebihan. Apalagi ia juga menitipkan urusan serupa kepada mantan Kepala Kepolisian RI, Jenderal Tito Karnavian, yang diangkat sebagai Menteri Dalam Negeri. Urusan radikalisme sebenarnya cukup diatasi dengan cara memperkuat Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Terorisme.
Pengangkatan sejumlah menteri lain tampak pula tidak didasari pertimbangan yang benar-benar matang. Rekrutmen tokoh muda, Nadiem Makarim, misalnya, sebetulnya cukup bagus. Hanya, banyak orang menyayangkan penempatannya yang kurang pas. Pendiri Gojek ini harus memimpin Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan, urusan yang baru sama sekali bagi dia.
Melihat banyaknya masalah pada kabinet baru, jangan heran jika beberapa pengamat politik memprediksi akan ada perombakan kabinet pada tahun depan. Bongkar-pasang seperti ini semestinya bisa dihindari bila Presiden lebih cermat dalam membangun koalisi dan menyusun kabinet.

Early Friction of Jokowi's Cabinet
Nov 6 2019, 05:45 by Ali Umar
As predicted, President Joko Widodo finally involved many political parties in his cabinet. This move aimed at forming a strong and effective government has actually caused a lot of harm. Coalitions that are too large tend to be not solid and prone to political friction, which will disrupt the performance of the cabinet.
The symptoms immediately arose when Jokowi announced the composition of the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet. A number of political parties were disappointed because they did not get a ministerial seat in accordance with their expectations. There are also parties supporting Jokowi who do not get any quota at all, either the minister's chair or the deputy minister. The ripples of disappointment could trigger political steps that disturb the solidity of the coalition supporting the government.
Maneuvering Chairperson of the Democratic National Party Surya Paloh is just one example. He suddenly met with the President of the Prosperous Justice Party Sohibul Iman in his office, last October. After the meeting, Paloh said he opened the option to become a "balancer" of the government like PKS. He also plans to communicate with other parties outside the cabinet, the National Mandate Party and the Democratic Party.
Paloh's step has the potential to inconvenience Jokowi because NasDem is in the government. NasDem won three ministerial seats, as in the cabinet last period. Only, this party has now lost an important position, namely the Attorney General. The post which was originally held by NasDem cadre, M. Prasetyo, is now occupied by St. Burhanuddin, a senior prosecutor known to be close to the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle.
The inclusion of Gerindra Party Chairperson Prabowo Subianto to the cabinet was reportedly also making the NasDem Party hot. Prabowo, who is known to be quite familiar with PDIP Chairperson Megawati Sukarnoputri, was appointed Minister of Defense. This situation makes NasDem's position less dominant in the coalition. The party is increasingly uncomfortable because the relationship between Paloh and Megawati has been tenuous because a number of regional heads promoted by PDIP have moved to NasDem.
Jokowi's decision to make the cabinet fat actually based on two wrong assumptions. First, Jokowi thinks his government will be strong if it is supported by many parties. He forgot that in the House of Representatives the map of support was strongly influenced by the issues discussed. If the issue is deemed unprofitable, even the coalition party can defect. In the first period of Jokowi's administration, PDI-P did not support government policies.
The second erroneous assumption is that Jokowi considers that a fat coalition will make it easier for him to adopt various development-oriented public policies. He considers that so far many of the government's "good plans" have been hampered by the political process in parliament. He forgets that there is never a good plan if it is not tested through a process of checks and balances. Every plan must contain a daif.
Now Jokowi also accommodates eight political parties, including the Indonesian Solidarity Party and the Indonesian Unity Party. This accommodative attitude has invited the jealousy of the People's Conscience Party and the Indonesian Justice and Unity Party. The two parties which have supported Jokowi since the past period did not receive any ministerial or deputy ministerial seats.
A sense of disappointment was also expressed by Nahdlatul Ulama figures, religious organizations that usually get the seat of the Minister of Religion. Since the era of President Abdurrahman Wahid, NU people have always occupied the post. In the first period's cabinet, Jokowi also still appointed NU figure Lukman Hakim Saifuddin. But this time he ignored that tradition by placing Retired General Fachrul Razi as Minister of Religion.
Jokowi appointed Fachrul with a special assignment, which was to confront radicalism. Strategies similar to the New Order style are actually excessive. Moreover, he also entrusted a similar matter to the former Indonesian Police Chief, General Tito Karnavian, who was appointed as Minister of the Interior. The problem of radicalism is actually quite overcome by strengthening the National Counterterrorism Agency.
The appointment of a number of other ministers also appears not to have been based on a truly mature consideration. The recruitment of young leaders, Nadiem Makarim, for example, is actually quite good. Only, many people regret the placement that is not quite right. The founder of the Gojek must lead the Ministry of Education and Culture, a matter that is completely new to him.
Seeing the many problems with the new cabinet, don't be surprised if some political observers predict there will be a cabinet reshuffle next year. Disassembly like this could have been avoided if the President had been more careful in building coalitions and arranging the cabinet.
